湖

Значения

Озеро

Мнемоника

Под старым 古 гниющим мясом 月 образуется озерцо жидкости 氵.

purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 胡 indicates the sound; 氵 (water) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
湖南 [ hú nán ]: Hunan province in south central China, abbr. 湘 , capital Changsha 长沙
湖北 [ hú běi ]: Hubei Province (Hupeh) in central China, abbr. 鄂
湖泊 [ hú pō ]: lake
江湖 [ jiāng hú ]: rivers and lakes; all corners of the country; remote areas to which hermits retreat; section of society operating independently of mainstream society, out of reach of the law; the milieu in which wuxia tales play out (cf. 武侠 ); (in late imperial times) world of traveling merchants, itinerant doctors, fortune tellers etc; demimonde; (in modern times) triads; secret gangster societies; underworld
湖畔 [ hú pàn ]: lakeside
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 氵 [ shuǐ ] water
    • 胡 [ hú ] recklessly, foolishly; wildly
heisig_chinese_memo: An ancient man standing under the moonlight next to the water of a lake.
heisig_constituent: lake, water, water droplets, water pistol, uncivilized, zombie, old, tombstone, gravestone, church, ten, needle, mouth, moon, month, flesh, part of the body
heisig_story: Water . . . old . . . flesh. You have heard of legends of people being abandoned in the mountains when they had become too old to work. Well, here is a legend about people being set adrift in the waters of a stormy lake because their flesh had gotten too old to bear the burdens of life.
koohiiStory1: This is my favorite story. Simply associate the sad moment of an OLD person, standing near the WATER of the lake and looking at the MOON reflected in the lake. The created primitives themselves are put so beautifully, that you will not forget this kanji.
koohiiStory2: Water reflects the old moon in the lake.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The tsunamis during the old moons (many moons ago) were responsible for the world's lakes.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Where did lakes come from? They are the residue of tsunamis from many moons ago.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: "That's where lakes come from," you tell the 子 (こ).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: This is just a stupid story to get this 子 to stop asking "why, why, why?" about everything. Earlier, the 子 asked "where do lakes come from?" and you had to come up with a crazy story to quiet them.
Ru_Notes: Фонетик: 胡 (なんぞ、ウ、コ、ゴ варвар, чужеземец), 古 (ふるい、コ старый).
Ru_Radicals: 十 (десять), 口 (рот), 汁 (суп), 月 (месяц)
Ru_trainchinese:
hú: (сущ) озеро
hú: (графема) Ху (указание на провинцию Хунань или Хубэй); Ху (указание на Хучжоу в провинции Чжэцзян)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the foreign (胡) water (氵) is a lake
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: An ancient man standing under the moonlight next to the water of a lake.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " water " to " hu " sound. The original meaning is large-scale water and lakes on land. "Shu Wen": "Lake, Dabei. From the water, Hu Sheng." Section note: "<𨸏 Bu> said: "Bei, one is called the pond." But Dabei is called the big pond." And "Guangya . Shi Di: "Hu, Chi Ye." For example, "Zhuangzi. Grand Master": "The spring, the fish and the land, are wet and moist, it is better to forget each other in the rivers and lakes." "Huainanzi. "Qi Su": "No salaries are sold in the forest, and no fish in the lake. All the rest is left."

" Lake " is also used as ancient place names and ancient water names, referring to lakes and Huzhou. It also specifically refers to Dongting Lake, China's Hunan Province and Hubei Province, that is, south of Dongting Lake and north of Dongting Lake.
humanum_short_description_en: From " water " to " hu " sound. The original meaning is large-scale water and lakes on land.
humanum_full_description:
從「水」，「胡」聲。本義是陸地上大範圍的積水、湖泊。《說文》：「湖，大陂也。从水，胡聲。」段注：「〈𨸏部〉曰：『陂，一曰池也。』然則大陂謂大池也。」又《廣雅．釋地》：「湖，池也。」例如《莊子．大宗師》：「泉涸，魚相與處於陸，相呴以濕，相濡以沫，不如相忘於江湖。」《淮南子．齊俗》：「林中不賣薪，湖上不鬻魚，所有餘也。」

　　「湖」也用作古地名、古水名，指湖水、湖州。又特指洞庭湖，中國的湖南省和湖北省即洞庭湖以南和洞庭湖以北。
humanum_short_description: 從「水」，「胡」聲。本義是陸地上大範圍的積水、湖泊。

湖(みずうみ): lake

從「 水 」，「 胡 」聲。本義是陸地上大範圍的積水、湖泊。《說文》：「湖，大陂也。从水，胡聲。」段注：「〈𨸏部〉曰：『陂，一曰池也。』然則大陂謂大池也。」又《廣雅．釋地》：「湖，池也。」例如《莊子．大宗師》：「泉涸，魚相與處於陸，相呴以濕，相濡以沫，不如相忘於江湖。」《淮南子．齊俗》：「林中不賣薪，湖上不鬻魚，所有餘也。」 「 湖 」也用作古地名、古水名，指湖水、湖州。又特指洞庭湖，中國的湖南省和湖北省即洞庭湖以南和洞庭湖以北。
From " water" to " hu" sound. The original meaning is large-scale water and lakes on land. "Shu Wen": "Lake, Dabei. From the water, Hu Sheng." Section note: " said: "Bei, one is called the pond." But Dabei is called the big pond." And "Guangya . Shi Di: "Hu, Chi Ye." For example, "Zhuangzi. Grand Master": "The spring, the fish and the land, are wet and moist, it is better to forget each other in the rivers and lakes." "Huainanzi. "Qi Su": "No salaries are sold in the forest, and no fish in the lake. All the rest is left." " Lake" is also used as ancient place names and ancient water names, referring to lakes and Huzhou. It also specifically refers to Dongting Lake, China's Hunan Province and Hubei Province, that is, south of Dongting Lake and north of Dongting Lake.

湖字的基本解释

湖
hú
陆地上聚积的大水：湖泊。湖泽。湖滩。湖荡。湖光山色。
指中国湖北省和湖南省：两湖。湖广。
指中国湖州（旧地名，在今浙江省吴兴县）：湖笔。湖绉。

湖字的汉语字典释义

[①]［hú］
［《廣韻》户吴切，平模，匣。］
(1)积水的大泊。
(2)指湖南省、湖北省。参见“湖廣熟，天下足”。
(3)指浙江省的湖州市。参见“湖筆”、“湖絲”。

湖字的英文翻译

◎ 湖
lake

湖字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　湖； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页637第04
【唐韻】戸吳切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】洪孤切，?音胡。【說文】大陂也。【周禮·夏官·職方氏】楊州，其浸五湖。【水經注】五湖，謂長塘湖，太湖，射貴湖，上湖，滆湖。　又水名。【水經注】湖水，出桃林塞之夸父山。　又州名。【廣輿記】屬浙江，吳曰吳興，隋唐曰湖州，今爲湖州府。

湖字的源字形

湖字的起名意思

：指湖泊，积水的大泊，如湖海，引申为天下之地；也指湖南，湖北，如两湖两广。

lake
Basic explanation of words
lake
hú
Large water accumulating on land: lakes. Huze. Lake beach. Lake swing. Lakes and mountains.
Refers to China's Hubei Province and Hunan Province: Lianghu. Huguang.
Refers to China's Huzhou (old place name, in today's Wuxing County, Zhejiang Province): Hubi. Lake crepe.
lake
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［hú］
["Guangyun" Hu Wuqie, flat mold, box. ]
(1) A large pond of stagnant water.
(2) Refers to Hunan Province and Hubei Province. See "Huguangshu, the world is sufficient."
(3) Refers to Huzhou City, Zhejiang Province. See "hu pen", "hu silk".

[Tang Yun] Jian Wu Qi [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun] Hong Gu Qi,? Yin Hu. [Said the text] Dabei also. 【Zhou Li·Xiaguan·Zhi Fang Family】Yangzhou, it is soaked in Five Lakes. [Shuijing Note] Five Lakes are called Changtang Lake, Taihu Lake, Shegui Lake, Shanghu Lake and Gehu Lake.　Also known as water. [Water Classic] The lake water, out of the Kuafu Mountain in Taolinsai.　Also the name of the state. [Guang Yu Ji] It belongs to Zhejiang, Wu Xing, Sui and Tang Huzhou, and today it is Huzhou Mansion.
lake
Source glyph
lake
Name meaning
: Refers to lakes and large ponds with water, such as lakes and seas, which are extended to the land of the world; also refers to Hunan and Hubei, such as the two lakes and Guangxi.
形声字。水()表意,篆书形体像河水,表示湖汇聚了河水;胡(hi)表声,胡指牛颈下的垂肉,其形较平展宽阔,表示
湖平展而宽阔。本义是湖泊。
①被陆地围着的大片积水:~水「~泊「洞庭~。2指浙
江湖州:一笔|~约。3指湖南、湖北:~广。
~滨 ~畔 ~色 ~泽~光山色 江~ 五~四海
湖
hú
觀湖|湖
隶
樹
Пиктофонетические символы.
Вода () означает, что шрифт печати подобен речной воде, что означает, что озеро собирает речную воду; Ху (хи) выражает звук, а Ху относится к свисающей плоти под шеей коровы. Его форма плоская и широкая. , что указывает на то, что озеро широкое и плоское.
Первоначальное значение - озеро.
①Большая площадь стоячей воды, окруженная сушей: ~ Шуй "~ Бо" Дунтин ~. 2 относится к Хучжоу, Чжэцзян: штрих | ~ ок. 3 относится к Хунани и Хубэй: ~ Гуан.
~ Пляж ~ Бан ~ Цвет ~ Цзэ ~ Гуаншань и река ~ Пять ~ Четыре моря
озеро

писец
дерево
hú
I сущ.
озеро; озёрный
湖鱼 озёрная рыба
贝加尔湖 озеро Байкал
II собств.
1) геогр. (сокр. вм. 湖州) Хучжоу (город в пров. Чжэцзян)
2) геогр. (сокр. вм. 湖南(北)) провинция Хунань (Хубэй)
两湖 провинции Хунань и Хубэй (также 湖广)
3) Ху (фамилия)
Radicals: 氵, 古, 月  (tsunami, old, moon)
Meaning Mnemonic
The tsunamis during the old moons (many moons ago) were responsible for the world's lakes.
Where did lakes come from? They are the residue of tsunamis from many moons ago.
Reading Mnemonic
"That's where lakes come from," you tell the 子 (こ).
This is just a stupid story to get this 子 to stop asking "why, why, why?" about everything. Earlier, the 子 asked "where do lakes come from?" and you had to come up with a crazy story to quiet them.
